clinicForBetterAccessibilityDesc: In clinics for better accessibility, insured persons who do not have a personal doctor (GP or Pediatrician) can choose their personal doctor (in case there is no available doctor or if the chosen personal doctor is permanently absent).
noResults: No doctor found based on your search criteria. Check if you have the right doctor type selected or zoom out the map.
doctorAvailability: Availability can be lower than 100% for doctors that work part time on preventive programs or in other units (e.g. dentist working with adults and youth).

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: In case of medical emergency you should contact emergency services or call 112.

reportError.title: Report error
reportError.text: Report error in doctor data and add the correct data or notes:
reportError.reportReceived: Thank you! We will look into it.
reportError.reportError: Error reporting failed. Please try again later.

confirmation.title: Confirm
confirmation.warningText: This form is NOT intended to request an appointment for medical examination or consultation. To make an appointment, contact your chosen doctor.
confirmation.text: Are you sure you want to suggest a data update?

sozialmarie.description: The Doctors Tracker portal was created to bring the healthcare system closer to the patient. In Slovenia, we are facing a shortage of doctors at primary level. This leaves many patients without the basic right of access to a personal GP. In the Scientific association Tracker, we imported the data that was publicly available every 15 days in a spreadsheet that was not user friendly into our portal and allowed users to suggest corrections for faulty data in real time. This gave patients seeking primary care user-friendly and up-to-date information.

touchDevice.text: Use desktop for the best experience.

data.iozRatio: Ratio of Individuals with a Personal Physician to Total Patients

popup.map: Geographical breakdown of the number of persons without primary care physician and the share of persons with primary care physician stratified by the primary care specialty. The selected municipality or group of municipalities is shown against the trend of the previous year.
popup.withoutIOZ: Persons without a primary care physician are those who pay regular health insurance contributions and do not have a chosen personal doctor, dentist or gynaecologist..

popup.private: Privately owned providers are institutions or individuals who are independent providers of health services (e.g. private concessionaires) with a contract with the Health Insurance Fund (ZZZS).
popup.public: Publically owned providers are institutions who are owned by municipality, state or other public institutions (ex. hospitals) who have contracts with National Insurance Fund (ZZZS).
